SENT.plain: A 53-year-old woman was admitted due to akinetic mutism and fever
On admission, brain computed tomography (CT) scan revealed a large hemorrhagic lesion in the left anterior lobe that required surgical operation for total removal
Her neuropsychiatric manifestation was not attenuated after the operation, and was gradually ameliorated by high doses of corticosteroid thereafter, suggesting a diagnosis of lupus psychosis

Histopathological examination revealed a necrotizing vasculature, sometimes with a disrupted lamina elastica interna, completely filled with thrombi and infiltrated with inflammatory cells and their debris
It is therefore suggested that the large frontal lobe hematoma in our patient was induced by thrombosis and arteritis in the subarachnoid space
